intro: Buchanania pseudoflorida, commonly known as the Philippine native tree, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows up to 15 meters in height. The plant has smooth, grayish-brown bark and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged alternately along the branches. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and yellowish-green, appearing in clusters, while the fruit is a spherical, fleshy drupe. This species is native to the Philippines and is valued for its timber and ornamental qualities.
